##"Mad Grab Double Coptis" is pure farce, the real Chinese medicine is such treatment of new crown

Health insight

Functional introduction, understand the health professional news

* In 2003"SARS" different, Chinese medicine in the first time to join the new crown anti-epidemic treatment.
* Only one week after the "human-to-human transmission" of coronavirus was revealed, the national version of the diagnosis and treatment plan was added to the "protocol side" of TCM.
* The medical team considered the new crown epidemic situation as "wet epidemic" , and the treatment policy was mainly to remove dampness, aiming at eliminating the living conditions of virus in human body.
* Beijing, Guangdong two Chinese Medicine Teams in Wuhan Jinyintan Hospital, the Hospital of integrated Chinese and Western medicine, took over some ward patients, so far significant efficacy, side effects smaller.
* The farce of "Shuanghuanglian anti-virus" deepens people's doubts about traditional Chinese medicine, and there should be dialectical thinking in treating traditional Chinese medicine anti-epidemic.

Different from SARS in 2003, new crown anti-epidemic therapy was added in the first time.

Only one week after the new coronavirus "human-to-human transmission" was revealed, the national version of the diagnosis and treatment plan was added to the "protocol side" of TCM.

The national team of traditional Chinese medicine considered the new crown epidemic situation as "wet epidemic" , and the treatment policy was mainly to remove dampness, aiming at eliminating the living condition of virus in human body.

Two TCM teams from Beijing and Guangdong have been stationed in Wuhan Jinyintan Hospital and the Integrated Hospital of traditional Chinese and Western medicine.

The farce of "Shuanghuanglian anti-virus" deepens people's doubts about traditional Chinese medicine, and they should think dialectically about traditional Chinese medicine's anti-epidemic.

Delta survey respondents

Dr. Huang Donghui has always remembered the gloomy smell of the ward on the afternoon of January 29. Wuhan that day is a sunny day, the sun through the window in the ward just took over, but the whole ward is like a wall of light, very depressed.

Huang Donghui is the Guangdong Provincial Hospital of Traditional Chinese Medicine Assistance Hubei Medical Team Temporary Party branch secretary, team leader. After arriving in Wuhan with the Guangdong Medical Team on January 27, more than 60 colleagues from the Chinese medical team took over the two wards of the Hubei Integrated Hospital of Traditional Chinese and Western medicine, with a total of 70 beds.

The team, which is composed of the Guangdong Provincial Hospital of traditional Chinese medicine, the First Affiliated Hospital of Guangzhou University of Traditional Chinese medicine and the Second Hospital of traditional Chinese Medicine of Guangdong Province, mainly treats critically ill patients by combining traditional Chinese and Western medicine. Many people in the medical team had experienced the rescue of SARS in 2003. Among them, Zhang Zhongde, the leader of the second Chinese Medicine Team in Hubei supported by the state and vice president of the Guangdong Provincial Hospital of Traditional Chinese medicine, and Huang Donghui himself had even been seriously infected with SARS, once in critical condition, both lungs were completely white in the imaging data. After Python, the patient recovered with the traditional Chinese medicine treatment. The lung did not leave any mark. Now, vigorous exercise such as swimming and running can be carried on as usual.

At the same time, Beijing medical team in a team of Chinese medicine, also at the same time in Wuhan Jinyintan Hospital, Hubei Province Integrated Hospital of traditional Chinese and Western medicine.

One of the biggest differences between this outbreak and the SARS period 17 years ago is that TCM has long since joined the treatment team, and governments at all levels have been pushing the issue. On January 20, the day after confirmation of the virus's human-to-human transmission, Liu Qingquan, director of the Capital University of Medical Sciences's Beijing Hospital of Traditional Chinese medicine, left for Wuhan. On January 24, the night of the New Year, zhang Zhongde, vice president of Guangdong Provincial Hospital of traditional Chinese medicine, travelled from Guangzhou to Wuhan alone. On the same day, Tong Xiaolin, a member of the Chinese Academy of Sciences and Vice President of scientific research at Guang 'Anmen Hospital of the Chinese Academy of Traditional Chinese medicine, and others travelled south to Wuhan. Then came academician Huang Luqi, president of the Chinese Academy of Traditional Chinese medicine.

On January 22, the national "new coronavirus diagnosis and treatment plan (Third Edition) " was released, adding the Chinese medicine prescription recommendations.

On January 25, the first day of the Lunar New Year, the Central Committee stressed the need to "strengthen the integration of Chinese and Western medicine" during the fight against the epidemic. On January 26, Tong held a conference call with a number of TCM masters and experts to discuss the TCM treatment plan. On January 27, the National Health Commission released the fourth edition of the protocol, which gives the exact amount of the prescribed prescriptions (especially those prescribed by the traditional Chinese medicine community after a certain period of time, accumulated a certain amount of experience and curative effect) .

Within a week of the confirmation of "human-to-human transmission" on January 20, the TCM protocol in the national version of the diagnosis and treatment plan was finalized and announced, a practice that had not occurred during the SARS period. It is very important to determine the direction of diagnosis and treatment because of the urgency of epidemic situation and the alarming speed of virus transmission. Since is "the agreement side" , then means is for reference to use the recipe, the follow-up can be different according to each place, formula adjustment.

Whether it is 17 years ago "SARS" , or new pneumonia, the role of traditional Chinese medicine in this epidemic has often been mentioned, but often forgotten in the public field of vision. Is it a controversial empirical medicine, or is it a system medicine that actually works? If "SARS" period of Chinese medicine in Beijing, Guangdong in the treatment of merit, it is the truth behind the treatment of what, this can also be used?

The patient condition is more serious than the imagination, the individual person resists the traditional Chinese medicine

January 29 was the first day of Huang's rounds. From the first ward, to the last ward, every ward, the pressure increases -- as if the patient is so weak, when asked about her condition, she can hardly speak, her asthma is dry and she has a bad cough. "We cut their pulse, mostly deep and smooth, with thick and greasy coating on the tongue, severe fever, constipation and dryness, and could not pull out for several days, and had little appetite. "

Although the medical team has the experience of fighting "SARS" , also made full preparations, but into the isolation ward, Huang Donghui still feel more serious than expected, the pressure is also great. At that time, the conditions of the ward has not been improved, there is no medical equipment such as monitors, and the risk of cross-infection is very high. Adding to the pressure on health care workers is the condition of the patients. The patients in the two wards are mostly elderly, with the maximum age reaching 90 or more. Many patients are also complicated with basic diseases such as hypertension and diabetes.

In TCM theory, mood and disease are closely related, and Huang Donghui's TCM team knows this. On the first round on January 29, he recalls, the medical team told the patients, "We are from Guangdong and have very mature experience. We are here and you can rest assured that you will be fine. Especially when our team leader (Vice President Zhang Zhongde) was knocked down by SARS, the situation was much more serious than you, and was also saved by the integrated program of Chinese and Western medicine, so you must believe us, you will be OK

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
When the patients heard this, Huang recalled, "they were so weak and weak that they struggled to sit up, clasped their hands and bowed their hands to thank us. They said we had to save him, and they still had a lot to worry about. "

After the first rounds, Huang and his colleagues worked late into the night. They consult the national version of the agreement side, carefully agreed Chinese Medicine Treatment Program. The next morning, boil good Chinese medicine was sent to the ward. But the resistance of some patients is throwing cold water on the issue. So far, he said, one or two patients have refused to drink traditional Chinese medicine. It's GonNa have to be tough on the patient, or we're GONNA have to recalibrate the program.

Huang Donghui said that although they are a team of traditional Chinese medicine doctors, they emphasize the combination of traditional Chinese and Western medicine in the course of specific treatment. The principle is to see which plan is more helpful to the condition of the patient. Critically ill patients, in particular, should be treated with a combination of traditional Chinese and Western medicine. Encountered more basic diseases of patients, the medical team will be through remote consultation means, gathering the wisdom and strength of Chinese medicine experts to formulate treatment programs. "We are also concerned about the risk of pulmonary fibrosis after discharge, which, if left unattended, can cause significant harm in all aspects of the patient's life. "

Many patients are very anxious, and doctors spend a lot of time in counseling. Most Make Huang Donghui move is, just begin to do treatment to the patient, the expression of a lot of people is extremely indifferent. And now, "as soon as you get close to them, you immediately put your hands on them and say, don't come near me, you will be infected. " In his opinion, this kind of feeling between people, through this kind of subtle movement, is very warm.

On February 5, the first critically ill patient in Huang's ward was discharged from the hospital. She was a 37-year-old woman who initially refused to take traditional Chinese medicine, but on the first day of taking it, her fever was almost gone. On the second day, the general condition of the body was better. After five sentences, the body gasped a little. There is also a marked change in stool, from the beginning of constipation to yellow molding. Tongue coating began to become thin, pulse also began to become smooth. You can sit up or get out of bed and walk around a bit. On the day of her release, she couldn't believe it herself, saying that if it hadn't been for the professional treatment and careful care of the medical staff, she probably wouldn't even be able to leave the hospital now. On the Lantern Festival, the woman also made a video to cheer on those who are still struggling with the disease and share her experience in fighting the disease.

So far, Huang's ward has treated 60 patients, all of whom are critically ill or severely ill, except for four with mild cases. Currently, 19 patients have been discharged from the hospital, and 22 patients have been transferred to the buffer ward (to the buffer ward according to discharge criteria) . Severe patients, after Chinese medicine treatment, effective quickly, the effect is obvious.

There was much laughter in the ward. Some ward patients will play together, or see some sketches, cross-talk video, divert attention.

As of 12:00 p.m. on Feb. 13, the Guangdong TCM team had treated 116 patients, including 85 severe cases, 14 critical cases and 8 mild cases, Zhang said at a Hubei News Conference on the evening of Feb. 14. At present, 19 patients have been discharged, and another 22 patients meet the discharge criteria, but remain in the buffer ward for observation.

The Beijing TCM team, led by academician Huang Luqi, also has 40 medical staff and is responsible for 42 beds in a ward of Jinyintan Hospital. As of 12:00 on 14 February, a total of 86 patients had been admitted, including 65 severe cases and two critical cases. So far, 33 people have been discharged from hospital, eight of whom are treated by pure Chinese medicine.

Huang Luqi said that 33 discharged patients (including those treated with integrated Chinese and Western medicine and pure Chinese Medicine) were compared with the Western medical treatment group in the hospital, the results showed that "in fever, cough, fatigue, dry throat, palpitation, loss of appetite and other 10 symptoms, than Western medicine group significantly improved" , and "integrated Chinese and Western medicine group, the average length of hospital stay, significantly less than Western medicine group.

"SARS" in the hands of those who lead

The outbreak, Chinese medicine in the first time to be able to intervene in the treatment work, and 17 years ago, "SARS" period played a role closely related. The Beijing medical team and the Guangdong medical team stationed at the two hospitals in Wuhan are both leaders of the first-line clinical treatment of SARS.

"SARS" is an unforgettable memory for Zhang Zhongde. He was in the first line of rescue patients, unfortunately infected with the SARS virus, critically ill, in Chinese medicine after the gradual recovery, leaving no sequelae.

The head nurse at the time, Ye Xin, was in a critical condition next to his bed. He watched in grief as his colleague, who had been fighting alongside him, died in vain. This time in Wuhan, he was ahead of other colleagues for a few days, has not slept well, the most worry is the protection of team members, he hoped to bring colleagues "health and health, but also bring them back safely, a lot of people. ". Fortunately, the Guangdong medical team is safe and sound.

There were three hospitals in Guangdong that treated SARS patients in that year. In addition to the Guangdong Provincial Hospital of Traditional Chinese medicine where Zhang Zhongde worked, there was also the First Affiliated Hospital of the Guangzhou Medical College under the leadership of Academician Zhong Nanshan, the other is the First Affiliated Hospital of Guangzhou University of Traditional Chinese Medicine, where Deng Tietao, a master of traditional Chinese medicine, is based.

After SARS, the First Hospital of Guangyi published a paper titled "71 cases of Clinical Research on SARS intervention with traditional Chinese medicine" to reveal the treatment results, it is believed that the severity of symptoms such as fever, chest tightness, cough, sweating and fatigue in patients in the Treatment Group of integrated traditional Chinese and Western medicine has been significantly improved, and "can block the condition to the severe pneumonia development but enters the convalescence directly" . According to the statistics of the paper, 71 patients received TCM intervention treatment, and one died, the mortality rate was only 1.4% .

Zhong Nanshan Co authored the paper. The experience of "SARS" has a direct impact on the response of Guangdong to coronavirus-infected pneumonia. On January 28, Zhong Nanshan told Xinhua, "We are also considering the role of Chinese medicine, which should be involved at the beginning, not at the end. This is what we do in Guangdong, and in many places. " The first hospital in Guangzhou, where he works, also treated patients with new coronary pneumonia, especially in a critical condition.

Beijing medical team is no lack of "SARS" personal experience. Tong Xiaolin, one of the authors of the National Accord, was on the front lines of the china-japan Friendship Hospital during SARS.

In 2004, the World Health Organization published the report "clinical trials of integrated Chinese and Western Medicine Treatment" , in which Tong Xiaolin participated, and 11 cases of pure Chinese medicine treatment in Beijing were observed, it concluded that the common SARS patients could be successfully treated with Chinese herbs alone, that Chinese herbs were effective in reducing fever, restoring lymphocyte levels and promoting inflammation absorption, and that liver and kidney function and routine blood tests showed, traditional Chinese medicine has no obvious toxicity or side effects; treatment with traditional Chinese medicine can avoid the side effects of heavy use of hormones and antiviral drug.

Several doctors who have been involved in the treatment of SARS said that after TCM intervention, hormone use was significantly reduced, and the problem of sequelae of SARS patients was greatly reduced, whether in Guangdong or Beijing.

One of Guangdong's pharmaceutical companies was responsible for supplying TCM granules to hospitals in the later stages of SARS. One of the leaders involved at that time remembers a doctor in Guangzhou who used a lot of hormones in the early days, left lung fibrosis, atelectasis problems, "later saw him, can not straighten the body, walking can only lie on the stomach. Later patients with Chinese medicine, but found that the general improvement quickly, and finally concluded that Zhong Nanshan to use Chinese medicine. "

The shanghai-based TCM treatment of SARS was led by the Chinese medical master Professor Yan Dexin, whose team was consulting patients in the isolation ward of the Shanghai Infectious Disease Hospital, as well as remote consultation of SARS patients in other regions of Zhejiang and Shanghai. A Mount Hua Hospital doctor involved in the case recalled that SARS developed rapidly and fever with Western medicine would recur, while traditional Chinese medicine generally took about three days and the body temperature gradually decreased. "Yan Dexin and his seven or eight apprentices supervise the battle every day and give the patients two or three times a day, sometimes changing it to once a day. The patients' symptoms improve remarkably. "

The doctor recalled that many patients in Beijing suffered from osteonecrosis of the femoral head, bullae of the lungs, and atelectasis as a result of early administration of 3-5 grams of glucocorticoid. "At that time, Deng Tietao of Guangzhou did not oppose the use of hormones, but suggested that traditional Chinese medicine could help reduce hormone doses. So he led the use of traditional Chinese medicine in Guangzhou, and as a result, the use of hormones has dropped significantly after the combination of Chinese and Western medicine."

Pathogenesis in "wet disease"

Within a week of Zhong Nanshan's confirmation on January 20 that the new coronavirus could be transmitted from person to person, the state's version of the diagnosis and treatment opinion gave the Chinese Medicine Treatment Protocol, which was later renamed "Qingfei Paidu decoction" and divided the clinical treatment into four stages, including the initial stage (cold-dampness stagnation of the lung) , the Middle Stage (virus-infected lung) , the critical stage (internal and external decubitus) and the recovery stage (Lung and Spleen Qi deficiency) , respectively gave a simple and specific recommended prescriptions.

For the new coronavirus, the idea of Western medicine treatment is how to fight the virus itself. There are high hopes for a yet-to-be-marketed antiviral drug, Remdesivir, but clinical trials are not expected until april-may at the earliest. In short, TCM is more concerned with changing the body's own internal environment and eliminating the virus's living conditions.

Deng Tietao, a master of Chinese medicine, was well-known for his treatment of SARS in Guangdong Province. His hospital treated 73 SARS patients and all of them were cured, with no death, no infection, no transfer and no sequelae. He wrote a detailed article on his thinking of Tcm Syndrome differentiation, summed up as "supporting people's Good Qi, so that evil has a way out. ". However, it is difficult to be understood by the public because the classical texts are mostly quoted. This time, Tong explained it in Layman's terms:

The new pneumonia is a "wet epidemic" , this year is a warm winter, some places should not snow when the snow, the earth is a bit warm. Then it rained, as it did in Wuhan in December 2019, and for 16 days, there was a cold and wet environment where the virus could easily spread. Therefore, the treatment of the national version of the protocol protocol is mainly for cold and dampness, in which the treatment of cold evil, with warm powder, through evil, with Xin Wenjie table method; treatment of damp evil, to avoid foul.

Tong Xiaolin in patients, whether critically ill patients in the ICU, or mild patients, tongue coating presents thick greasy rot fur, indicating a serious wet turbid phenomenon. The idea of traditional Chinese medicine is to change the condition of "damp and turbid" in human body. In the early stage, some medicines such as Ephedra, Patchouli, atractylodes and so on were used slightly to get wet. In the middle stage, the idea of treating diseases with maxing Shigan decoction in treatise on Febrile Diseases was also put emphasis on removing dampness.

Deng Tietao in his "SARS" experience of the paper has long hinted at the fact that such viruses rely on the wet environment to survive. Damp-heat is difficult to treat, the most easy lingering, which is why many patients with the new coronavirus will appear in the Western medicine under the effect of fever medicine, such as a period of time, stable, and suddenly there is a sharp increase in symptoms. Deng said in the paper, "antipyretic needle antipyretic, and I do not know to sweat to remove evil, sweating Li disease will not get rid of. Sweat can antipyretic for a while, and then hot again. "

The symptomatic treatment of TCM, on the surface is a unique method of permeability, dampness, behind is completely different from Western medicine treatment path. Huang said that after using the protocol in his ward, patients took it for an average of three days to reduce their fever, and there was no recurrence of fever. In particular, Tong said, because cold and dampness are the pathogenesis, so the treatment process to reduce unnecessary infusion, excessive infusion will aggravate cold and dampness.

In addition to removing dampness, the other focus of the agreement side is to regulate the spleen and stomach, support the human body Qi (that is, the Western medicine understanding of immunity) . Tong Xiaolin told the media that when he examined the patients in Wuhan, he found that most of them had symptoms of the spleen and stomach, which are very typical, such as fatigue, poor appetite, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea or constipation, therefore, the prescription contains the spleen and stomach of Li Zhong Tang, Liu Junzi soup and other components.

On January 27, after the release of the fourth edition of the diagnostic and therapeutic plan, the State Administration of Traditional Chinese Medicine (SATCM) decided to pilot Qingfei Paidu Soup in Shanxi, Hebei, Heilongjiang and Shaanxi provinces. According to the State Administration of Traditional Chinese Medicine, as of February 4,214 confirmed cases had been treated in four provinces under the agreement, with a three day course of treatment with a total response rate of more than 90 percent, of which more than 60 percent showed significant improvement in symptoms and imaging, needle shape was stable and non-aggravation in 30% of patients. This is the result of clinical data since the outbreak of the new coronavirus.

In this epidemic, "pneumonia No. 1" , which was popularized in Guangdong Province, is different from the national version of the agreement in the compatibility of traditional Chinese medicine, but it has also achieved better curative effect. In the 8th People's Hospital of Guangzhou, 50% of the 50 cases of mild syndrome disappeared, 52.4% of the symptoms of sore throat disappeared, 69.6% of the symptoms of fatigue disappeared, and none of the patients became serious. Since February 4, Guangdong "pneumonia No. 1" was approved after the start of production, the supply of provincial patients with mild illness.

Since then, the practice of TCM in treating NCP has been adopted by various provinces and cities, and in addition, the national level has been pushing hard. According to incomplete open information statistics, henan, Zhejiang, Guangdong, Guizhou, Hunan, Shandong and many other provinces have promoted the traditional Chinese medicine treatment of NCP.

Compared with other provinces and cities in China, there is still a long way to go for the participation of TCM in the treatment of NCP in Hubei Province. Dr. Liang Tengxiao, who participated in the first-line treatment in Wuhan, said it was because Hubei has too many patients and too few TCM resources. Even if a protocol is included in the national version, TCM treatment depends on doctors developing a personalized Chinese medicine decoction tailored to each patient's specific circumstances.

But it is too difficult for many Western hospitals, which do not have reserves of traditional Chinese medicine. "For example, if a chef who is used to western food suddenly asks him to be a 'Kung Pao chicken' , he is not well adjusted, " said Liang.

With all the sand and mud, the drama of two lovers

Despite the government's push, traditional Chinese medicine is still hard to find its way to hospitals across Hubei Province, where doctors do not yet understand it and people are even harder to identify it. In the days when the outbreak quickly escalated, Chinese medicine also produced mixed sounds of fish and dragons, especially a mass scramble around Shuanghuanglian.

In the late evening of January 31st, state media first announced a joint discovery by the Shanghai Institute of Medicine and the Wuhan Institute of Virology that the Chinese Patent Medicine Shuanghuanglian oral liquid could inhibit COVID-19. The source said Shuanghuanglian oral liquid is made up of honeysuckle, SCUTELLARIA BAICALENSIS and Forsythia Suspensa, adding that modern medical research holds that it has broad-spectrum antiviral, antibacterial and immune-enhancing effects.

As soon as the news came out, the spread of Shuanghuanglian oral liquid was rapidly snatched by the public and became a new hot commodity after the mask. But soon, there were voices of doubt. In response, the Shanghai Institute of Medicine said that "the initial discovery of Shuanghuanglian has an inhibitory effect on the virus" and that "no detailed study has been conducted so far" and "only a preliminary verification has been made in Wuhan Virus" , "The follow-up meeting in Shanghai is the Clinical Medicine (research) center to do some experiments. ". As for whether the idea of suppressing the virus was accurate, the institute gave a definitive answer, but acknowledged that the conclusion was based solely on results from in vitro studies in the laboratory, to be confirmed by further clinical studies.

Many experts in the industry pointed out that rigorous clinical trials, is to prove whether the effective criteria. Zhang Wei, a member of the Shanghai Expert Group on the prevention and control of new coronavirus, said that people should not take Shuanghuanglian on their own to prevent new coronavirus. Liu Qingquan, the head of the Beijing Hospital of Traditional Chinese medicine, who first went to Wuhan to treat patients, stressed that not all people are suitable for taking Shuanghuanglian, "Shuanghuanglian is a bitter cold medicine, some people spleen and stomach deficiency cold words, eating will be uncomfortable, will hurt the spleen and stomach. "

The appearance of Shuanghuanglian is one of the many "farce" related to traditional Chinese medicine since the outbreak of the epidemic. As a matter of fact, the treatment of TCM based on syndrome differentiation can not be treated simply in the way of Western medicine, for example, it can not be used in a dismembered way to verify the direct effect of the use of a particular Chinese medicine on the virus. Thus, it is not only a misinterpretation of traditional Chinese medicine, but also not conducive to the real diagnosis and treatment of integrated Chinese and Western medicine.

By Ji Minhua

Micro Signal: Jane Jiminhua
